entry.summary: May 13, 2025 10:20 a.m. Central Douglas Fire & Rescue firefighters are currently flushing and maintaining fire hydrants in their service area. This includes the communities of Dixonville, Green, Melrose, Winchester, Wilbur, Winston, Garden Valley and unincorporated areas near the City of Roseburg. Testing is being conducted from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Mondays through...

entry.summary: May 13, 2025 10:10 a.m. The YMCA of Douglas County will have an AS1 basketball clinic with Coach Miles Hayes from June 30th through July 2nd. Hayes has been coaching and running youth basketball camps and clinics for nearly 30 years in Oregon, California and abroad. The first clinic will be for kids aged 7-12...

entry.summary: May 13, 2025 3:50 a.m. Less than 4 percent of local ballots have come in as the deadline approaches for the 2025 Douglas County May Special Districts Election. entry.title: REP HOYLE ISSUES STATEMENT ON RELEASE OF EDAN ALEXANDER
entry.summary: May 13, 2025 3:50 a.m. On Monday, 4th District Representative Val Hoyle issued a statement after the release of Edan Alexander, the last remaining living American hostage that was in Hamas captivity. Hoyle said, “Edan Alexander has been freed from Hamas captivity and has finally come home to his family. His freedom is long overdue”....

entry.title: ROSEBURG SALVATION RECEIVES GRANTS FROM COBANK, DOUGLAS ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE

Captain Edith Dye-Mabie said the Roseburg Corps is blessed to receive much-needed funding...

entry.title: PEACE OFFICER MEMORIAL CEREMONY TO BE HELD THIS THURSDAY
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 3:40 a.m. In 1962, President John F. Kennedy signed a proclamation designating every May 15th as Peace Officer Memorial Day, and the week in which it falls as National Police Week. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will host a local Peace Officer Memorial Ceremony on the front lawn of the courthouse...
